Project profile onto existing principal component axes (PCA)

Source: R/processStudy.R
projectSample2PCA.Rd

This function calculates the profile eigenvectors using the specified SNP loadings.

projectSample2PCA(
  gdsProfile,
  listPCA,
  currentProfile,
  np = 1L,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

gdsProfile

an object of class SNPRelate::SNPGDSFileClass, an opened Profile GDS file.

listPCA

a list containing two entries:

  • pca.unrel snpgdsPCAClass object

  • snp.load snpgdsPCASNPLoading object

currentProfile

a character string representing the identifiant of the profile to be projected in the PCA.

np

a single positive integer representing the number of threads. Default: 1L.

verbose

a logical passed to the PCA function. Default: FALSE.

Value

a snpgdsPCAClass object, a list that contains:

  • sample.id the sample ids used in the analysis

  • snp.id the SNP ids used in the analysis

  • eigenvalues eigenvalues

  • eigenvect eigenvactors, “# of samples” x “eigen.cnt”

  • TraceXTX the trace of the genetic covariance matrix

  • Bayesian whether use bayerisan normalization

Details

More information about the method used to calculate the patient eigenvectors can be found at the Bioconductor SNPRelate website: https://bioconductor.org/packages/SNPRelate/

Author

Pascal Belleau, Astrid Deschênes and Alexander Krasnitz

Examples


## Path to the demo pedigree file is located in this package
dataDir <- system.file("extdata", "RAIDS")
